communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Kentucky Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: RE: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky SEA response
communications.communication:
Your request was received on 5/2/25. The Kentucky Open Records Act provides that agencies shall respond to requests within 5 business days following receipt. The Kentucky Department of Education (KDE) will issue a response to your request within 5 business days following KDE’s receipt of the request on 5/2/25.

Sincerely,

Todd G. Allen
Deputy Commissioner & General Counsel
Office of Legal Services

Phone: (502) 564-4474
Email: Todd.Allen@education.ky.gov<mailto:Todd.Allen@education.ky.gov>
300 Sower Blvd. – 5th floor
Frankfort, KY 40601

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Citations/arrests LAPD 41.18
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 
Please search January 6, 2025 to January 16, 2025.

I am requesting records related to the arrests and citations using 41.18 

Please provide me with the dates, locations, ages, and other demographics collected by those ticketed/arrested. 

Officer deployment records for officers engaged in LASAN CARE+ and RESET operations. The records should include names, hourly costs, and the number of officers involved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Your City of Los Angeles public records request #25-5306 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City of Los Angeles ************************************************************************ Record request #25-5306 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Requester,   We have received your request for officer deployment records related to the LASAN CARE+ and RESET operations.   Your request was made under the California Public Records Act (the Act). The Department is cognizant of its responsibilities under the Act. It recognizes the statutory scheme was enacted to maximize citizen access to the workings of government. The Act does not mandate disclosure of all documents within the government’s possession. Rather, by specific exemption and reference to other statutes, the Act recognizes that there are boundaries where the public’s right to access must be balanced against such weighty considerations as the right of privacy, a right of constitutional dimension under California Constitution, Article 1, Section 1. The law also exempts from disclosure records that are privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt under either express provisions of the Act or pursuant to applicable federal or state law, per California Government Code Sections 7927.200; 7927.700; 7923.600-7923.625; 7927.705; and 7922.000. In regard to Deployment records, specifically names and number of officers involved, to the extent the record exists, the Department has a strong interest in maintaining the confidentiality of records that consist of or contain detailed tactical, operational, deployment information, and analysis of potential threats. Disclosure of this information to the public has the potential to enable would-be perpetrators to discern areas of vulnerability and the intelligence assessments, evade security procedures, thereby endangering the operation of the Department and the safety of its officers and the public in the event of similar law enforcement initiatives. Therefore, these records are exempt from disclosure. In regard to hourly costs, please refer to the City Controller's website at the following link: Payroll Explorer   If you have any questions, please respond to this email.   Respectfully,   LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Los Angeles.

Technical support: See our help page

title: CORA Surety Bond / Liability Insurance Request

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CORA Surety Bond / Liability Insurance Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am filing a request under the Freedom of Information Act, The Sunshine Act 5 U.S.C. § 552b, and The Colorado Open Record Act (CORA) C.R.S. § 24-72-201.

NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT

I request an electronic copy of the following documents:

As Per HB 13-1072:

 * Individual, Schedule, or Blanket Corporate Surety Bond (if applicable)  - CO Rev Stat § 20-1-101
 * Public Official Surety Bond (if applicable) - CO Rev Stat § 22-32-104(1)4b
* Surety Liability Insurance Policy (if applicable). 
* Acceptable Security. CO Rev Stat § 20-1-101
* Criminal Insurance Policy if applicable. 
* Power of Attorney Surety Bond Company
* Blanket Power of Attorney Blanket Surety Bond from Surety Bond Company if applicable
* Good Faith Insurance Policy if Applicable
* Errors & Omissions (E&O, a Surety Liability Insurance policy, and the Duty of Care policy if applicable
* Certificate of Liability
* Faithful Performance Bond
* Fidelity Bond
* Public Employee Dishonesty Policy
* Statutory Bond
* Deputy of Care policy
* Risk Management Policy
* Oath of Office
* A photocopy of the following documents if applicable:
      ACORD 125
      ACORD 126
      ACORD 127
      ACORD 128
The documents should indicate the policy number and the insured amount of the policy.

I am requesting the above documents for the following individuals:

Michael Hancock - Mayor of Denver
Molly Duplechian - Executive Director, Office of Excise and License
Dominic Vianna - Deputy Director, Office of Excise and License
Brian Snow - Lead Investigator, Office of Excise and License

If you are not the custodian of records for this request, please forward this letter to the appropriate person or let me know who to contact for these records. I request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public's understanding of short term rental license enforcement abuse in Denver, Colorado.

Please supply this record to me via email within a reasonable time (3 working days) or less pursuant to C.R.S. § 24-72-203(3)(b). Also pursuant to the same section, records that are readily available should be provided right away. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is NOT being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

pooanon

communications.subject: Re: Denver CORA Request
communications.communication:
Muckrock.com recipient:

I write in response to your attached request. Department of Finance has conducted a good faith search for the records you requested and the responsive record located is attached. We have attached our "Government Crime Insurance" policy, which is what we believe you mean when you say "criminal" insurance. This policy has been renewed with the same conditions as of 5/1/25, but we do not yet have the new policy in hand. Also below is an email sent for the same request dated March 11, 2022.

The Denver Clerk and Recorder would most likely be the custodian of any additional records within the scope of your request, and you may submit requests to that office if you wish to do so. You can find contact information for them at the following link:

https://www.denvergov.org/Government/Agencies-Departments-Offices/Agencies-Departments-Offices-Directory/Clerk-and-Recorder/find-records/CORA

This response is governed by the Colorado Open Records Act and applies only to records in the custody of the Department of Finance. Thank you for your inquiry. Please let us know if you have any questions.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington SEA reponse
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Washington Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LAPD Community Safety
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Community Safety Advisory Council - Strategic Safety Plan 2021 - 2023 

Timeframe for all, unless otherwise stated is 2021-2023 for documents, reports, files, and communications. Please search each Community Safety Partnership (CSP) location and neighborhood

- SSP Exercises and Monthly Action Items Tracker (Each Month for every location 2021 - 2023)
- Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design written assessments (every location any assessments from 2021 -2023)
From the committee guide for reference: "Following the CPTED walk-through, the CSP Team Leaders (sergeants) prepared a written
assessment. A copy should have been distributed to each of you before today’s meeting, giving
you the opportunity to review the assessment."
- Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats (SWOT) reports and documents 
- Root Cause Analysis reports and documents 
- SARA reports for each location from 2021 - 2023
- Defining Common Terms reports and documents
-  Actionable Initiatives reports and documents 
- Milestones reports and documents
- Meeting Minutes for every location, every meeting "Meeting minutes should be shared with the community at the Resident Advisory Council
(RAC) meetings or made accessible online for transparency."
- Roster of Members on the Committees for each location, broken down by year

Below is the source document for the basis of the request. 
https://www.lapdcsp.org/_files/ugd/a060ef_183eb0795e6f42ad94ed2c2735ad7858.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

Please note that some of the records to be provided, if any, may be redacted pursuant to California Government Code Sections 7927.200; 7927.700; 7923.600-7923.625; 7927.705; and 7922.000. We will provide an update by January 24, 2025, and will notify you should anything change.   If you have any questions, please respond to this email.   Respectfully,   LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of Los Angeles public records request #24-13091
communications.communication:
City of Los Angeles ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #24-13091: Dear Requester:   We reviewed your request for:   * SSP Exercises and Monthly Action Items Tracker (Each Month for every location 2021 - 2023) * Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design written assessments (every location any assessments from 2021 -2023) * Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats (SWOT) reports and documents * Root Cause Analysis reports and documents * SARA reports for each location from 2021 - 2023 * Defining Common Terms reports and documents * Actionable Initiatives reports and documents * Milestones reports and documents * Meeting Minutes for every location, every meeting "Meeting minutes should be shared with the community at the Resident Advisory Council (RAC) meetings or made accessible online for transparency." * Roster of Members on the Committees for each location, broken down by year   Your request was made under the California Public Records Act (the Act). The Department is cognizant of its responsibilities under the Act. It recognizes the statutory scheme was enacted to maximize citizen access to the workings of government. The Act does not mandate disclosure of all documents within the government’s possession. Rather, by specific exemption and reference to other statutes, the Act recognizes that there are boundaries where the public’s right to access must be balanced against such weighty considerations as the right of privacy, a right of constitutional dimension under California Constitution, Article 1, Section 1. The law also exempts from disclosure records that are privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt under either express provisions of the Act or pursuant to applicable federal or state law, per California Government Code Sections 7927.200; 7927.700; 7923.600-7923.625; 7927.705; and 7922.000.   In regard to items 1, 3, 4, and 7-10, the Department has conducted a search based on the information provided and no responsive records were located.   In regard to items 2, 5, and 6, the Department requires time to review records for any information exempt under various provisions of the CPRA. We estimate that the non-exempt records responsive to your request, if any, will become available on February 28, 2025. We will notify you should anything change.   If you have any questions, please respond to this email.   Respectfully,   LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Los Angeles.
Technical support: See our help page

title: Brady List (March 2025) (Walla Walla County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (March 2025) (Walla Walla County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Your Walla Walla County public records request #25-302 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Walla Walla County ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-302 has been submitted successfully. This letter serves as Walla Walla County’s initial five-day letter, pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, to your public records request. After your request is reviewed for content and we determine the department or office in which your request refers to, the County will provide an estimate to provide an initial installment of responsive records. After locating responsive records, the County will determine whether any of the responsive documents are subject to applicable exemptions under the Public Records Act, and to notify any third parties affected by the request. If third party notification is required, twenty (20) business days will be allowed for a response by the third party to those records which specifically pertain to them. As records are reviewed, they may be released on an installment basis. Additionally, the Washington Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and Walla Walla County Resolution 23-201 now allow the County to charge for provision of electronic records. Refer to the hyperlinked documents for the fee schedule for future records installments. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Walla Walla County.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Your Walla Walla County public records request #25-302 has been closed.
communications.communication:
Walla Walla County ************************************************************************ Record request #25-302 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: This letter serves as Walla Walla County’s response, pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, to your public records request. After searching for responsive records, we have found several files responsive to this request. An email with directions on how to download responsive records will be/has been sent separately. An exemption log, if applicable, is provided with responsive records with appropriate exemptions for redactions to affected documents. Please contact Walla Walla County within thirty (30) days if you have additional questions, or if you believe identifiable and responsive records have not been provided. This is Walla Walla County’s final, definitive response to this records request. Walla Walla County considers this request closed. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.550, you have one year from today to seek judicial review of Walla Walla County’s response to this records request. Any action brought more than one year from today may be dismissed outright by a court as untimely.  ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Walla Walla County.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Massachusetts DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Principal Personnel Files, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

* Jason Roberts, Interim Principal
* David T Stachowiak, Assistant Principal
* Lidia Paredes, Assistant Principal  

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements/agreements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

05/08/2025 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N017410-042325 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals: 

* Jason Roberts, Interim Principal 
* David T Stachowiak, Assistant Principal 
* Lidia Paredes, Assistant Principal 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements/agreements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-principal-personnel-files-2025-185490%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1u7m0R%3A5DCsNoeFcz62G5ZU5RgofLYAhatxlnTyhqFvWdxH3IM RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, citizenship status, signatures, personal addresses/phone numbers, medical information, names of victims, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Student information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Identities of complainants have been redacted pursuant to section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Hawaii DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI files: Colin Powell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request an electronic copy of all FBI files on Colin Powell, the former U.S. Secretary of State who died in October 2021. Here is his obituary: https://www.latimes.com/obituaries/story/2021-10-18/colin-powell-dead-covid-19

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1507448-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 111 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 895 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,929 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Leonard Zeskind
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Leonard Zeskind, who tracked right-wing hate groups. He was born in 1950 and died on April 15, 2025. His death was widely covered in the press: 

https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/24/us/politics/leonard-zeskind-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: FBI support for 2023 FX miniseries "Class of '09"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2023 FX miniseries "Class of '09"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2023 FX TV miniseries "Class of '09." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Class of '09," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Class of '09."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Capgemini (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding all agency records of work performed by CapGemini subject any contract award within the scope of this contract: https://www.usaspending.gov/federal_account/070-0540 created during FY18, FY19, FY20.

1. All Statements of Work/Performance Work Statements or any other Deliverables Requirement for work Capgemini carries out.
2. All Invoices from Capgemini to the agency
3. All reports from Capgemini to the agency regarding work performed. 
4. All subject-matter reports and related records regarding ICE detention centers or CBP hold rooms or processing facilities. 
5. All requests for equitable adjustment, contract modifications, contract discrepancy reports, or modifications to any agreements between Capgemini and the agency. 
6. Any agency reviews of Capgemini contract performance or work product.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: ICE Clarification Request FOIA Number 2021-ICFO-35115
communications.communication:
May 19, 2021  Muckrock News DEPT. MR 91149 411A Highland Ave. Somerville, MA 02144-2516  RE:     ICE FOIA Case Number 2021-ICFO-35115 
This e-mail is in regards to your December 18, 2020 ICE FOIA request for records regarding all agency records of work performed by CapGemini subject any contract award within the scope of this contract: https://www.usaspending.gov/federal_account/070-0540 created during FY18, FY19, FY201. All Statements of Work/Performance Work Statements or any other Deliverables Requirement for work Capgemini carries out2. All Invoices from Capgemini to the agency3. All reports from Capgemini to the agency regarding work performed4. All subject-matter reports and related records regarding ICE detention centers or CBP hold rooms or processing facilities5. All requests for equitable adjustment, contract modifications, contract discrepancy reports, or modifications to any agreements between Capgemini and the agency6. Any agency reviews of Capgemini contract performance or work product. 

In conducting a search for responsive records, the ICE FOIA office has determined that further clarification is needed regarding your request. In order to further process your request, please reference a contract number for Capgemini. Please provide the ICE FOIA office with a response as soon as possible to avoid any further delay in the processing of your request. If a response is not received within 30 days, your request will be administratively closed. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2021-HQFO-00312
communications.communication:
I have provided you a link to the specific source of records I seek. I am not required by ICE’s regulations to identify a contract number. Nor will I. You, on the other hand, are required to conduct a good-faith, timely search with the strong presumption in favor of disclosure wherever ambiguity exists. The timing and content of your follow-up is evidence you are violating these statutory and regulatory obligations. Consequently, if you fail to conduct a search based on my failure to identify a contract number, I intend to seek referral of this matter to the Office of Special Counsel and report your office’s illegality to relevant oversight committees in Congress. 

Please cease your office’s ongoing lawbreaking. Conduct an adequate search and release all non-exempt portions of responsive records without further delay. 

Thank you,

Andrew

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2021-HQFO-00312
communications.communication:
We appeal the agency’s denial of this request. 

Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

Andrew Free

communications.subject: [ACTION NEEDED] Department of Homeland Security FOIA 2022-HQFO-00389
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Mr. Free, 
We wanted to reach out to you for clarification to item 1 of request. The training you reference on page 10 of lists ICE's training for 2018, since our FOIA Offices are decentralized we would need to refer this item 1 to ICE and consequently Item 2 which is clearly linked to Item 1. 
This page also talks about trainings the Privacy Office hosted that were carried out by OGIS, DOJ, ASAP and the Graduate School. Are you interested in those ? We needed some clarification as to what it is that you are interested in. We will place these two items on hold until we receive clarification from you on this. 1. All DHS FOIA policy and training materials referenced on Page 10 of the DHS Chief Privacy Officer's 2018 Chief FOIA Officer Report: https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/publications/2018%20Chief%20FOIA%20Officer%20Report.pdf (https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/publications/2018%20Chief%20FOIA%20Officer%20Report.pdf) 2. All subsequent versions of FOIA policy and training materials provided to DHS FOIA personnel and DHS agency components’ FOIA personnel AFTER 2018 DHS Chief Privacy Officer’s FOIA report and BEFORE December 21, 2021.
Regards, 
DHS Privacy Office 
Disclosure & FOIA Program 
STOP 0655 
Department of Homeland Security 
245 Murray Drive, SW 
Washington, DC 20528-0655 
Telephone:  1-866-431-0486 or 202-343-1743 
Fax:  202-343-4011 
Visit our FOIA website (http://www.dhs.gov/foia)

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-HQFO-00389
communications.communication:
Good morning, 

Thanks very much for following up. 

If the decentralization of the FOIA offices means there won’t be DHS FOIA records of those trainings and they’ll be with ICE FOIA instead, it makes sense to do an intra-agency referral for the ICE records. We consent to that. 

If the other offices’ trainings referenced on page 10 won’t be likely to be stored by ICE FOIA, or if DHS FOIA has them, maybe you can retain and task only that portion of the request? I’d consent to that as well. 

Finally, I can file a cloned request with ICE FOIA and spare the referral from you all, allowing you to administratively close this request and remove it from your queue, if you believe DHS FOIA has no responsive records. 

Really appreciate your follow up.  Please let me know how you’d like to proceed?

Best regards,

Andrew

communications.subject: ICE FOIA Request 2022-ICFO-07344
communications.communication:
February 10, 2022 Andrew Free MuckRock News DEPT MR 122446 411A Highland Ave Somerville, Massachusetts 02144-2516 RE:     ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICFO-07344  Dear  Free: This acknowledges receipt of your January 13, 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all DHS FOIA policy and training materials referenced on Page 10 of the DHS Chief Privacy Officer's 2018 Chief FOIA Officer Report: https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/publications/2018%20Chief%20FOIA%20Officer%20Report.pdf, as well as all subsequent versions of FOIA policy and training materials provided to DHS FOIA personnel and DHS agency components’ FOIA personnel AFTER 2018 DHS Chief Privacy Officer’s FOIA report and BEFORE December 21, 2021.  Your request was received in this office on January 13, 2022. PLEASENOTE: Requesters seekingresponsive records from the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) areencouraged to create a DHS FOIA Public Access Link (PAL) accountat: . Creating a PALaccount will allow you to directly submit your FOIA request to ICE and trackthe status of your request. In PAL, you can view your prior PAL submissions,sent correspondences, and responsive records. Although PAL is preferred, ICEFOIA will continue to accept FOIA requests via email at (https://foiarequest.dhs.gov/) https://foiarequest.dhs.gov or via regularmail at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, Freedom ofInformation Act Office, 500 12 ICE-FOIA@ice.dhs.gov th St. SW, STOP 5009, Washington,DC 20536-5009. Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10- day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you care to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 
Your request has been assigned reference number 2022-ICFO-07344. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. To check the status of an ICE FOIA/PA request, please visit . Please note that to check the status of a request, you must enter the 2022-ICFO-07344 tracking number. If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the FOIA office. communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-ICFO-07344
communications.communication:
Sharon:

Thanks very much for your email. 

The email we received is copied and pasted below:

February 10, 2022

 
Andrew Free

MuckRock News DEPT MR 122446

411A Highland Ave

Somerville, Massachusetts 02144-2516

 
RE:     ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICFO-07344

       

Dear Free:

 
This acknowledges receipt of your January 13, 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all DHS FOIA policy and training materials referenced on Page 10 of the DHS Chief Privacy Officer's 2018 Chief FOIA Officer Report: https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/publications/2018%20Chief%20FOIA%20Officer%20Rep ort.pdf, as well as all subsequent versions of FOIA policy and training materials provided to DHS FOIA personnel and DHS agency components’ FOIA personnel AFTER 2018 DHS Chief Privacy Officer’s FOIA report and BEFORE December 21, 2021.  Your request was received in this office on January 13, 2022.

 

PLEASE NOTE: Requesters seeking responsive records from the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) are encouraged to create a DHS FOIA Public Access Link (PAL) account at: https://foiarequest.dhs.gov. Creating a PAL account will allow you to directly submit your FOIA request to ICE and track the status of your request. In PAL, you can view your prior PAL submissions, sent correspondences, and responsive records. Although PAL is preferred, ICE FOIA will continue to accept FOIA requests via email at ICE-FOIA@ice.dhs.gov or via regular mail at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, Freedom of Information Act Office, 500 12th St. SW, STOP 5009, Washington, DC 20536-5009.

 
Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10- day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you care to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.

 
Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued.

   
We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.


Your request has been assigned reference number 2022-ICFO-07344. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. To check the status of an ICE FOIA/PA request, please visit http://www.dhs.gov/foia-status. Please note that to check the status of a request, you must enter the 2022-ICFO-07344 tracking number. If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the FOIA office. You may send an e-mail to ice-foia@ice.dhs.gov, call toll free (866) 633-1182, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison, Marcus Francis, in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

Regards,


ICE FOIA Office
Immigration and Customs Enforcement
Freedom of Information Act Office
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009
Telephone: 1-866-633-1182
Visit our FOIA website at www.ice.gov/foia

We appeal the untimely response to this agency referral. We FOIA’d DHS. We reasonably described the records we were seeking. DHS has never responded. Please remand with instructions to timely respond. 

Please stop obstructing access to this vital information with make-work, irrelevant questions designed to cut off transparency. You have a duty to construe this request with a presumption of openness.  

Thank you, 

Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-ICFO-07344
communications.communication:
Ms. Cisneros: 

I am appealing: 

(1) DHS’s failure to make a timely determination on all three requests.
The agency has NEVER made the legally required determination. See CREW v. FEC (DC Cir 2013) for a summary of your unmet obligations in making a determination. 

(2) DHS’s January 2022 referral / transfer decision to ICE. 
We separately sought the same records from ICE. What we wanted in making this request was insight into what supervision—or lack thereof—the DHS Chief FOIA/PA Officer engages in when it comes to this serially deficient and unlawful component’s conduct. DHS has violated FOIA by failing to ensure ICE responds to this referral in a timely manner. 

(3) DHS’s failure to timely provide an estimated date of completion.
The agency has never even attempted to comply with this statutory obligation 

(4) DHS’s failure to make responsive records promptly available. 
A  year and a half response period is unreasonable and violates 5 USC 552(a)(3)(A). See Owen v. ICE (CD Cal). 

Please adjudicate this appeal. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICFO-07344
communications.communication:
Andrew Free 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 122446 
Somerville, Massachusetts 02144-2516 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICFO-07344 
 
Dear Requester: 

This letter is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), dated 1/13/2022.  You have requested all DHS FOIA policy and training materials referenced on Page 10 of the DHS Chief Privacy Officer's 2018 Chief FOIA Officer Report: https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/publications/2018 Chief FOIA Officer Report.pdf, as well as all subsequent versions of FOIA policy and training materials provided to DHS FOIA personnel and DHS agency components’ FOIA personnel AFTER 2018 DHS Chief Privacy Officer’s FOIA report and BEFORE December 21, 2021. 

ICE has considered your request under both the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a.  Information about an individual that is maintained in a Privacy Act system of records may be accessed by that individual unless the agency has exempted the system of records from the access provisions of the Privacy Act. 

ICE has conducted a search of the ICE Office of Regulatory Affairs and Policy (ORAP) for records responsive to your request and no records responsive to your request were found. 

For your information, Congress excluded three discrete categories of law enforcement and national security records from the requirements of the FOIA.  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(c) (2006 & Supp. IV (2010).  This response is limited to those records that are subject to the requirements of the FOIA.  This is a standard notification that is given to all our requesters and should not be taken as an indication that excluded records do, or do not, exist. 

While an adequate search was conducted, you have the right to appeal this determination that no records exist within the above mentioned ICE office(s).  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of the original response letter, within 90 days of the date of the letter following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.8.  You may submit your appeal electronically at GILDFOIAAppeals@ice.dhs.gov or via regular mail to: 

U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security 
500 12th Street, S.W., Mail Stop 5900 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5900 

Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

Provisions of FOIA allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge. 

If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St., SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009 and refer to your tracking number. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 
Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Incident Reports, August 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Supply records sufficient to show a listing of incident reports (ICT Record List) from August 1, 2024 through August 31, 2024 for all CPS schools.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17409

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N017409-042325
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
05/08/2025 Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N017409-042325 Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Supply records sufficient to show a listing of incident reports (ICT Record List) from August 1, 2024 through August 31, 2024 for all CPS schools. 

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-incident-reports-august-2024-185486%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1u7lyi%3A1AMyyo2dH74yq7kH4IHRpgVqe5Dnyq1usdsdn_9plAM RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please be advised that certain event reasons have been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c) exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy... “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: FOIA Request for Records Pertaining to Alicia A. Orzel Arrest on June 30, 2023

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request for Records Pertaining to Alicia A. Orzel Arrest on June 30, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records related to the arrest of Alicia A. Orzel on June 30, 2023, at approximately 3:48 p.m. in the town of Edgewater on Lake Chetac:

All body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the incident.

All dash camera footage from patrol vehicles present during the incident.

Incident and arrest reports detailing the circumstances of the arrest.

Any rear seat camera footage from patrol vehicles transporting Ms. Orzel.

Any other relevant audio or video recordings related to this incident.

This request pertains to charges of felony battery to a sheriff’s deputy and misdemeanor disorderly conduct during a child custody dispute.

I request a fee waiver as disclosure of these records serves the public interest by providing insight into law enforcement procedures and public safety matters, not for commercial gain.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format. If any records are exempt from disclosure, please specify the exemption and release any segregable portions.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

March 24, 2025

Police Cam News,

Response to Open Record Request:
I received your Open Records Request regarding:
Incidents involving Alicia A. Orzel, from June 30, 2023 for all BWC, Incident and Arrest Reports, All Dash Camera Footage

The Sheriff's Office did not have Dash Cam at this time of incident. 

We are in receipt of your request and will get this released as soon as possible.
Releasing your record in a more timely manner is now possible with our portal at https://sawyercountywi.nextrequest.  
Here, in our portal you can upload documents, pay online and receive all records in an email. 
Otherwise, we will notify you upon completion and all records will be released upon receiving payment in physical medium format.
Open Records are released in order received
Reproduction cost of $0.25 cents a page, plus $1.92 for each five-minutes, reflecting the assumed staff time involved to scan the document, attach it, and e-mailing, will be assessed. If manual research is required for retrieval, a fee will be determined in addition to the reproduction cost. According to Wisconsin Statute § 19.35(3) (c), we may charge the actual and necessary location costs using the locator’s hourly wage as the base cost.  Redaction cost will apply due to financial gain status. Redaction cost is based on the lowest paid employee’s hourly wage capable of performing the task. A representative of a person(s) on the report will be subject to a $1.92 redaction cost. 
Estimated Cost is $24.79
Due to the high demand for Open Records Request the estimated time is one month.
Please provide a waiver from the person(s) on the record releasing the images of them, and if any, of minor children present in the report, which would save redaction time. 
You will receive a notice upon completion of processing your request of the Open Record, if a response isn’t received within 10 business days, we will consider the request abandoned and closed. 
We accept Check, Money Order or Cash at the Sheriff’s Office.
Make payment payable to: Sawyer County Sheriff

Records will be released upon receiving payment.

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request for Records Pertaining to Alicia A. Orzel Arrest on June 30, 2023
communications.communication:
Hello, 

To be clear, will you notify me upon sending the invoice, or do you want me to pay the $24.79 estimate right away?

Unfortunately, I don't have any waivers. Let me know if any other information or payment is needed, I will be happy to comply.

Good morning, 
I can get these records released in one of two ways. 
Please mail your payment in to: Sawyer County Sheriff's Office, PO Box 567 Hayward 54843 in the amount of $24.79, we accept cash or money order. 
In return we will mail the material to the return address provided on payment. 
 
We can also release the records through our portal at sawyercountywi.nextrequest.com.
 Here you will be able to pay-online, once that payment is received the material will be release through email that is provided in portal.

Please let me know what you would like to do and I will get the material in ready format. 

Thank you,

Thank you!

Thanks for your assistance.

Kind regards,
Desiree Velazquez
Sawyer County Sheriff's Office
