communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Field Interview Cards (Irvine Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting copies of blank field interview cards or equivalent forms filled out during a police stop. Search 2018 to 2024, if there have been no changes since 2018 to the cards, then that year is sufficient. 

Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Georgia Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Library Contract Request: IEEE at Georgia Gwinnett College

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Library Contract Request: IEEE at Georgia Gwinnett College
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with THE INSTITUTE OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONICS ENGINEERS, INCORPORATED (“IEEE”) relating to the licensing of IEEE Xplore Digital Library;

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with IEEE for journal licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of IEEE Xplore Digital Library.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

M

communications.subject: [Open Records Request] Confirmation
communications.communication: [Open Records Request] Confirmation Thank you for your records request.  The Office of Legal Affairs will respond to your request as soon as possible.  If you have any questions please contact our office at openrecords@ggc.edu.

communications.subject: RE: [Open Records Request] Form Submission Results
communications.communication:
Good morning.

Please be advised that we are in receipt of your request. Pursuant to Georgia’s Open Records Act, the College is permitted to assess a reasonable fee for the administrative costs and copying fees associated with your request. The administrative fee that can be charged must not exceed the salary of the lowest paid full time employee who has the necessary skill and training to perform the request. This administrative fee may be charged for all but the first quarter hour of time required to complete the request. We have contacted the appropriate office to assist in the retrieval of this information and have requested an approximate cost to do so, if any. In accordance with the applicable time line, we will provide requested documents, an estimate of cost, or an update regarding your request. If you desire to have copies of any of the documents, please let us know, but be advised that a copying fee of $0.10 per page will be charged.

Please feel free to contact our office with any questions or concerns.
Pia Vanessa F. Tupper
Paralegal
office: 678-407-5207
email: ptupper@ggc.edu<mailto:ptupper@ggc.edu>
Georgia Gwinnett College
Office of Legal Affairs
B-3750
1000 University Center Lane
Lawrenceville, GA 30043
